COTSWORTH'S DIRECT CALCULATOR. Series
.O.R.' Bound full Leather, 458. Including Reciprocal Tables from 1
to 10,000,000.
This work contains over 1,000,000 distinct results and is used for making calculations of MULTIPLI-
CATION, DIVISION, AVERAGE, PERCENTAGE, INTEREST, EXCHANGE, SQUARE and CUBE
ROOT, and General and Scientific Calculations of all combinations of numbers. Multiplication of any three
figures by any other three figures from 1 to 1,000 is seen at a glance. Larger numbers
being easily worked in groups of three figures.

THE PUBLISHERS' CIRCULAR and BOOKSELLERS' RECORD
OF BRITISH AND FOREIGN LITERATURE.
Published by THE PUBLISHERS' CIRCULAR, LIMITED, St. Dunstan's House,
Fetter Lane, London.
every SATURDAY, PRICE THREE-HALFPENCE.
In addition to Articles and Notes and Announcements of Literary Interest, it
gives full particulars of all New Books published during each week, also a
Monthly List of Books in the last issue for each month.
ANNUAL SUBSCRIPTION, 8s. 6d. post-free,
:::*. Advertisements for about 2,000 out of print and scarce 'BOOKS WANTED'
appear in the ' Publishers' Circular' each week.


## p. 3 (#7) ################################################

PREFATORY NOTE
This seventieth yearly issue of the English Catalogue of Books comprises the
titles (in duplicate-namely, under author and subject) of works published during
1906, also of some received too late for inclusion in the sixty-ninth issue.
Titles and index are in one alphabet. The main entry of each work begins
with the author's surname (if given on the title page) in heavy type. As an
index to these “Author' records, the title, commencing with its most important
word (which usually indicates the classification to which the work belongs) or with
its first word, is repeated in the same alphabet, with that word in italics, which in
the main entry is in thick type.
The Transactions' of Learned Societies are recorded in an Appendix.
The names and addresses of the publishers of Great Britain and Ireland will be
found at the end of the volume, followed by those of the principal publishers in the
United States and in Canada. The telegraph and cable addresses and telephone
numbers have been added when known.
Hearty thanks are due to many publishers, secretaries, authors, and biblio-
graphers who have assisted in making this book more correct and comprehensive
than it otherwise would have been.
The Editor will be glad to have particulars of author, price, publisher, and
month of publication of any work which may have been omitted. Information as
to each book should be on a separate slip of paper or post card. It should be
addressed to
The Editor of The Englisb Catalogue of Books,
Publishers' Circular Office,
St. Dunstan's House, Fetter Lane,
London, E.C.
January 15, 1907.
AFR 1$ 1907 213396
A

THE ENGLISH CATALOGUE
DIRECTORY OF PUBLISHERS
Publishers have been invited to send us their Telegraphic Addresses and Telephone Numbers.
Those sont will be found below between square brackets [ ], and separated from each other by a
semicolon (;).
--
-
-
This list of Publishers, with their Addresses, has been principally compiled with a view to supplying informa-
tion regarding the books in the 1906 English Catalogue. This will explain the inclusion of many firms in the
list who can scarcely, in the strict acceptation of the term, be called Publishers, since the publication of books
forms only an occasional portion of their business.

ULISH
CATALOGUE OF BOOKS
1605
FOR THE FIVE YEARS 1901-1905
This volume, which has been produced at an expense of many hundreds of pounds, contains particulars
of Size, Prioe, Publisher and Date of Publication of
About Forty-Eight Thousand Works.
As the information is given under SUBJECT as well as AUTHOR the total number of entries is
NEARLY ONE HUNDRED THOUSAND.
The Work is practically a KEY TO ENGLISH LITERATURE, as it includes all the Latest Editions of all
Standard and other Works in the English Language published in the Years 1901, 1902, 1903, 1904 & 1905.
Publishod for THE PUBLISHERS' CIRCULAR, LIMITED, by SAMPSON LOW, MARSTON & COMPANY,
17a Paternoster Row, E.C., and 100 Southwark Street, S.E., London.
